mobiles.name: ajax
mobiles.long_description: Ajax stands proudly before you.
mobiles.description:
Ajax is a mighty warrior, the most powerful of the Achaens, save for
Achilles. He is a proud man, and his pride may one day lead to his
downfall.

mobiles.name: achilles
mobiles.long_description: Achilles sits here, sulking.
mobiles.description:
Achilles is sulking in his tent due to a slight from Agamemnon. This is
unfortunate for the Achaeans, as he is their most powerful warrior. He is
favored of the gods, and possessed of supernatural defenses as he was
dipped in the Styx while a babe. He was given a choice long ago to live a
long but uneventful life, or a short but action-filled life, and he chose
the latter.

mobiles.name: odysseus
mobiles.long_description: Odysseus, King of Ithaca, grins as he concocts another scheme.
mobiles.description:
Odysseus is a powerful warrior, the strongest of the Achaens, and the most
cunning. While not the best combatant, he more than compensates for this
with his quick wits, which keep him alive long after all his allies have
died.

mobiles.name: agamemnon
mobiles.long_description: Agamemnon, king of Mycenae and commander of the Achaens, stands before you.
mobiles.description:
Agamemnon, one of the two Atreides, is the commander-in-chief of the Greek
forces who are amassed here to "rescue" Helen from the Trojans. He is stern
and haughty, and also quite hard and unrelenting in his quest for vengeance.

mobiles.name: nestor
mobiles.long_description: Nestor, king of Pylos, smiles politely at you.
mobiles.description:
Nestor is ruler of the port of Pylos, who came with a small force to aid
his allies Menelaus and Agamemnon. An elderly man, he is one of the few
to survive the Trojan War and the subsequent journey home.

mobiles.name: menelaus
mobiles.long_description: Menelaus, King of Sparta, frowns worriedly.
mobiles.description:
Menelaus, one of the Atreides, is one of the central players in this war, for
it is because of the kidnapping of his wife Helen by Paris that the Achaens
have come here. Menelaus is worried for his wife, whom he loves greatly.

mobiles.name: patroclus
mobiles.long_description: Patroclus, favorite of Achilles, stands here quietly.
mobiles.description:
Patroclus is the favored err... "companion" of Achilles. Achilles cares
deeply for him, but when he goes into his sulk, Patroclus enters the field
wearing his armor, and is slain by Hector, who thinks him to be Achilles.
But that is another story.

mobiles.name: paris
mobiles.long_description: Paris, a prince of Troy, glares arrogantly at you.
mobiles.description:
Here he is, the rogue who stole away Helen from Menelaus. Paris is not a mean
or spiteful man, just a lustful one. Unfortunately his breach of the host-
guest code of behaviour will cost his whole city its existence.

mobiles.name: hector
mobiles.long_description: Hector, brother of Paris, stands before you.
mobiles.description:
Hector is one of the mightiest heroes of Troy, save maybe for Aeneas if you
believe Virgil. He is the favorite son of his parents, and of Troy. He is
in charge of the Trojan forces.

mobiles.name: priam
mobiles.long_description: Priam, king of Ilium, hobbles weakly forward.
mobiles.description:
Priam is the elderly king of Troy, and father of Paris and Hector. He is
too infirm to command his army in battle so that task falls to his favorite
son, Hector.

mobiles.name: aeneas
mobiles.long_description: Aeneas, champion of Troy, stands before you.
mobiles.description:
Aeneas is according to Virgil the greatest of the Trojans, and the one
who escapes to found Rome. He is a powerful warrior, and a just and
honorable, if proud, man.

mobiles.name: helen
mobiles.long_description: Helen, consort of Paris and wife of Menelaus, stands here.
mobiles.description:
Helen is the cause, albeit not willingly, of the war. She was "kidnapped"
by Paris, whom she developed a deep affection for due to the machinations
of Aphrodite.

mobiles.name: cassandra
mobiles.long_description: Cassandra, priestess of Apollo, foretells the fall of Troy.
mobiles.description:
Cassandra is the sister of Hector and Paris. She fooled the god Apollo into
giving her the power of prophecy, which he couldn't reverse, so he cursed
her by having it that no-one would ever believe her prophecies.

mobiles.name: andromache
mobiles.long_description: Andromache, the wife of Hector, stands here.
mobiles.description:
Andromache is married to Hector, Ilium's favorite son. She stands here on
the walls watching her husband lead the soldiers into battle.

mobiles.name: hecabe
mobiles.long_description: Hecabe, Queen of Ilium, smiles sadly.
mobiles.description:
Hecabe is the wife of Priam, and mother of Hector, Paris and Cassandra. And
that's all there is to say, really.

mobiles.name: automedon
mobiles.long_description: Automedon, squire of Achilles, stands ready here.
mobiles.description:
Automedon is one of Achilles' Myrmidons, and serves as his squire. He also
serves as squire for Patroclus when he goes into battle.

mobiles.name: aias
mobiles.long_description: Aias stands here whining insolently.
mobiles.description:
Aias was in a race for the armor of Achilles, against Odysseus, and was
tripped when he was ahead by Athena so Odysseus would win. He got a face
full of dung, and isn't happy about it.

mobiles.name: chalcas
mobiles.long_description: Chalcas, son of Thestor, prophesies about the future.
mobiles.description:
Chalcas is the chief prophet and augur of the Achaen expedition, and offers
wise advice with his gods-granted powers.

mobiles.name: chryseis
mobiles.long_description: Chryseis, daughter of Chryses, weeps to herself.
mobiles.description:
Chryseis was captured at Thebe by Achilles and alloted to Agamemnon. Apollo,
deity of her father, forced Agamemnon to return her.

mobiles.name: briseis
mobiles.long_description: Briseis stands here looking confused.
mobiles.description:
Briseis is the source of the quarrel between Achilles and Agamemnon. When
Agamemnon was forced to return Chryseis, he took Briseis from Achilles,
who had rightfully captured her. Achilles lost face, and decided to retreat
to his tent to nurse his injured pride.

mobiles.name: antilochus
mobiles.long_description: Antilochus, son of Nestor, grunts in greeting.
mobiles.description:
Antilochus is the brother of Thrasymedes, and the son of King Nestor of
Pylos. He is a brave and capable warrior, and loyal to his father.

mobiles.name: thrasymedes
mobiles.long_description: Thrasymedes, son of Nestor, grunts in greeting.
mobiles.description:
Thrasymedes is the brother of Antilochus, and the son of King Nestor of
Pylos. He is a brave and capable warrior, and loyal to his father.

mobiles.name: diomedes
mobiles.long_description: Diomedes, king of Argos, smiles and greets you.
mobiles.description:
Diomedes is an affable-enough fellow, very found of Tydeus his father. He
is of even temper, and much more likeable than most of the surly Achaeans.

mobiles.name: eurypylus
mobiles.long_description: Eurypylus stands ready for combat.
mobiles.description: An Achaean soldier who has seen action fighting Paris. He is unremarkable.

mobiles.name: idomeneus
mobiles.long_description: Idomeneus, son of Deucalion and King of Crete, is one of Agamemnon's captains.
mobiles.description:
Idomeneus is easily one of the most ablest officers in Agamemnon's staff,
and quite amiable to boot. He is able in command and in combat.

mobiles.name: machaon
mobiles.long_description: Machaon, son of the famous Asclepius, tends to the sick here.
mobiles.description:
Machaon, along with his brother Podaleirius, serves as chief physician to
the Achaen troops.

mobiles.name: menestheus
mobiles.long_description: Menestheus, son of Prince Peteos, leads the Athenian contingent.
mobiles.description:
Menestheus is the son of Prince Peteos, ruler of Athens, and has been
sent in charge of the troops Athens sent to aid her allies.

mobiles.name: meriones
mobiles.long_description: Meriones, nephew of Idomeneus, stands ready.
mobiles.description:
Meriones is squire to Idomeneus, and also second in command of the Cretan
contingent.

mobiles.name: sthenelus
mobiles.long_description: Sthenelus, squire of Diomedes, stands ready to assist his master.
mobiles.description: Sthenelus is an unremarkable squire.

mobiles.name: talthybius
mobiles.long_description: Talthybius, herald of Agamemnon, stands outside the tent.
mobiles.description: He is Agamemnon's chief herald.

mobiles.name: greater aias
mobiles.long_description: The greater Aias strings his bow and eyes you cautiously.
mobiles.description:
The greater Aias is the greatest archer of all the Achaeans. He is the son
of King Telamon, the ruler of Salamis, and is thus sometimes called
Telamonian Aias.

mobiles.name: thersites
mobiles.long_description: Thersites scratches himself and spits on the ground.
mobiles.description:
A common foot soldier, Thersites is remarkable only for his unruliness, and
his big mouth, which gets him killed by Achilles eventually.

mobiles.name: tleopolemus
mobiles.long_description: Tleopolemus smiles grimly and readies his weapons.
mobiles.description: Tleopolemus is the son of Heracles and Astyocheia, and hails from Rhodes.

mobiles.name: antenor
mobiles.long_description: Antenor the traitor sneaks past.
mobiles.description:
Antenor was called a traitor for he advised his king to give up Helen to
the Achaeans, and when they took Ilium they spared him. He was a Trojan
noble.

mobiles.name: deiphobus
mobiles.long_description: Deiphobus, another Prince of Troy, strolls past you.
mobiles.description:
Deiphobus is another son of Priam and Hecabe. When Paris is slain he weds
Helen and is subsequently slain by Menelaus for his troubles.

mobiles.name: glaucus
mobiles.long_description: Glaucus son of Hippolochus stands here.
mobiles.description: Glaucus is second in command of the Lycian allies under Sarpedon his cousin.

mobiles.name: helenus
mobiles.long_description: Helenus, yet another Prince of Troy, casts an augury.
mobiles.description:
Helenus is another son of Priam and Hecabe. Like Cassandra, his sister, he
has the gift of prophecy. He eventually weds Andromache.

mobiles.name: neoptolemus
mobiles.long_description: Neoptolemus, son of Achilles, swaggers past you.
mobiles.description:
Neoptolemus may be the son of Achilles, but he isn't a patch on his father
in terms of ability or strength.

mobiles.name: idaeus
mobiles.long_description: Idaeus stands ready in the court.
mobiles.description:
Idaeus is the herald of king Priam, his chief herald in fact. Not the most
exciting of jobs, really.

mobiles.name: pandarus
mobiles.long_description: Pandarous, son of Lycaon, is here.
mobiles.description: Pandarus is a fool, a treacherous one at that too. He isn't very important.

mobiles.name: polydamas
mobiles.long_description: Polydamus, a Trojan general, surveys his men.
mobiles.description:
Despite being a commoner, Polydamus is one of Troy's best warriors and
leaders. He is a cautious, clear-headed strategist, one of the ablest of
the leaders on either side.

mobiles.name: sarpedon
mobiles.long_description: King Sarpedon, king of Lycia and a son of Zeus himself, is here.
mobiles.description:
Sarpedon is the commander of Troy's Lycian allies, and is a competent
ruler. His mother, Laodameia, was the daughter of Bellerophon, slayer of
the Chimera, and tamer of the Pegasus.

mobiles.name: achaean soldier
mobiles.long_description: An Achaean soldier marches back and forth.
mobiles.description: This fellow has been fighting for nine years.

mobiles.name: trojan soldier
mobiles.long_description: A Trojan soldier marches back and forth.
mobiles.description: This fellow has been fighting for nine years.

mobiles.name: trojan citizen
mobiles.long_description: A Trojan citizen hurries by.
mobiles.description: These citizens are sick of the war.

mobiles.name: trojan citizen
mobiles.long_description: A Trojan citizen hurries by.
mobiles.description: These citizens are sick of the war.

old_objects.name: spear
old_objects.description: A short thrusting spear is jabbed in the dirt here.

old_objects.name: spear
old_objects.description: A long throwing spear has been thrust into the dirt here.

old_objects.name: ox hide shield
old_objects.description: An ox hide shield rests on the ground here.

old_objects.name: boar tusk helm
old_objects.description: A boar tusk helm lies here.

old_objects.name: leather jerkin
old_objects.description: A leather jerkin lies in the dirt here.

old_objects.name: bronze breastplate
old_objects.description: A bronze breastplate has been left here.

old_objects.name: goblet wine
old_objects.description: A goblet of watered wine rests here.

old_objects.name: board game
old_objects.description: A board game rests on a table here.

old_objects.name: achilles breastplate
old_objects.description: Achilles' breastplate lies here.

old_objects.name: achilles greaves
old_objects.description: Achilles' greaves lie here.

old_objects.name: achilles helm
old_objects.description: Achilles' helm lies here.

old_objects.name: achilles' sword
old_objects.description: Achilles' sword lies here.

old_objects.name: bronze sword
old_objects.description: A bronze sword lies here.

old_objects.name: bronze dagger
old_objects.description: A bronze dagger with lions carved upon it lies here.

old_objects.name: bronze shield
old_objects.description: A bronze shield has been left here.

old_objects.name: achilles' shield
old_objects.description: Achilles' shield lies here.

old_objects.name: sandals
old_objects.description: A pair of sandals lie here.

old_objects.name: stone axe
old_objects.description: A stone axe lies here.

old_objects.name: banner
old_objects.description: A banner is stuck in the ground here.

old_objects.name: bronze helm
old_objects.description: A bronze helm with horsehair plume lies here.

old_objects.name: cot
old_objects.description: A cot with heavy furs piled on it sits here.

rooms.name: Sailing Over the Wine Dark Sea
rooms.description:
You are sailing across the deep seas of the north. Dawn appears, fresh and
rosy-fingered, and catches you making your way across the wine dark stretches
of the deep sea, sailing toward whatever adventures may wait.

rooms.name: Sailing Over the Wine Dark Sea
rooms.description:
You are sailing across the deep seas of the north. Dawn appears, fresh and
rosy-fingered, and catches you making your way across the wine dark stretches
of the deep sea, sailing toward whatever adventures may wait.

rooms.name: Sailing Over the Wine Dark Sea
rooms.description:
You are sailing across the deep seas of the north. Dawn appears, fresh and
rosy-fingered, and catches you making your way across the wine dark stretches
of the deep sea, sailing toward whatever adventures may wait.

Mountains loom to the south, though you do see a point where you could 
set ashore.

rooms.name: Sailing Over the Wine Dark Sea
rooms.description:
You are sailing across the deep seas of the north. Dawn appears, fresh and
rosy-fingered, and catches you making your way across the wine dark stretches
of the deep sea, sailing toward whatever adventures may wait.

rooms.description:

rooms.description:

of the deep sea, sailing toward whatever adventures may wait.

rooms.description:

rosy-fingered, and catches you making your way across the wine dark stretches

rooms.name: Sailing Over the Wine Dark Sea
rooms.description:
You are sailing across the deep seas of the north. Dawn appears, fresh and
rosy-fingered, and catches you making your way across the wine dark stretches
of the deep sea, sailing toward whatever adventures may wait.

rooms.name: Sailing Over the Wine Dark Sea
rooms.description:
You are sailing across the deep seas of the north. Dawn appears, fresh and
rosy-fingered, and catches you making your way across the wine dark stretches
of the deep sea, sailing toward whatever adventures may wait.

rooms.name: Sailing Over the Wine Dark Sea
rooms.description:
You are sailing across the deep seas of the north. Dawn appears, fresh and
rosy-fingered, and catches you making your way across the wine dark stretches
of the deep sea, sailing toward whatever adventures may wait.

The coastline is visible from here, though there is no place to land.

rooms.name: Sailing Over the Wine Dark Sea
rooms.description:
You are sailing across the deep seas of the north. Dawn appears, fresh and
rosy-fingered, and catches you making your way across the wine dark stretches
of the deep sea, sailing toward whatever adventures may wait.

The coastline is visible from here, though there is no place to land.

rooms.name: Sailing Over the Wine Dark Sea
rooms.description:
You are sailing across the deep seas of the north. Dawn appears, fresh and
rosy-fingered, and catches you making your way across the wine dark stretches
of the deep sea, sailing toward whatever adventures may wait.

The coastline is visible from here, as are several black hulled ships, all
moored to the north.

rooms.name: Sailing Over the Wine Dark Sea
rooms.description:
You are sailing across the deep seas of the north. Dawn appears, fresh and
rosy-fingered, and catches you making your way across the wine dark stretches
of the deep sea, sailing toward whatever adventures may wait.

The coastline is visible from here, though there is no place to land.

rooms.name: Sailing Over the Wine Dark Sea
rooms.description:
You are sailing across the deep seas of the north. Dawn appears, fresh and
rosy-fingered, and catches you making your way across the wine dark stretches
of the deep sea, sailing toward whatever adventures may wait.

rooms.name: Sailing Over the Wine Dark Sea
rooms.description:
You are sailing across the deep seas of the north. Dawn appears, fresh and
rosy-fingered, and catches you making your way across the wine dark stretches
of the deep sea, sailing toward whatever adventures may wait.

The coastline is visible from here, though there is no place to land.

rooms.name: Sailing Over the Wine Dark Sea
rooms.description:
You are sailing across the deep seas of the north. Dawn appears, fresh and
rosy-fingered, and catches you making your way across the wine dark stretches
of the deep sea, sailing toward whatever adventures may wait.

The coastline is visible from here. You could moor in a small inlet to the
east near the walls of a great city.

rooms.name: The Shallows
rooms.description:
You are currently bobbing up and down in the shallows. To the north lies
a huge plain, littered with tents and armored men, who are grouped around
the walls of a huge city. It looks as if some fierce fighting has taken
place here.

rooms.name: An Inlet
rooms.description:
You are bobbing up and down in an inlet below a small cliff than lies beneath
the walls of a massive city- TROY. You could ascend this way, if you have
the means, otherwise you will have to sail round till you find a more
convenient disemarkation point.

rooms.name: Flying up the Cliffs
rooms.description:
You are traveling by a method which eluded the Achaeans besieging Troy-
flight. If they could fly the war would have ended years ago. You chuckle
at their misfortune and continue to travel. The walls lie to the east of you.
Below lies the wine-dark sea.

rooms.name: The Battlefield
rooms.description:
You are walking across the battlefield before the walls of Troy, where the
besieging army of the Achaeans, led by Agamemnon, have sat encamped for
years, the monotony only broken by the occasional battle. Tents lay
everywhere, housing the many soldiers that currently call this place home.

rooms.name: The Battlefield
rooms.description:
You are walking across the battlefield before the walls of Troy, where the
besieging army of the Achaeans, led by Agamemnon, have sat encamped for
years, the monotony only broken by the occasional battle. Tents lay
everywhere, housing the many soldiers that currently call this place home.

rooms.name: The Battlefield
rooms.description:
You are walking across the battlefield before the walls of Troy, where the
besieging army of the Achaeans, led by Agamemnon, have sat encamped for
years, the monotony only broken by the occasional battle. Tents lay
everywhere, housing the many soldiers that currently call this place home.

rooms.name: Achilles' Tent
rooms.description:
Achilles is in here, moping. He lost face when Agamemnon took Briseis from
him, and he is punishing the Mycenaean ruler by refusing to take to the
field, a move which is costing the Achaeans dearly, as he is their best
warrior.

rooms.name: Ajax's Tent
rooms.description:
This tent is the abode of the hero Ajax. He is usually not here, as he
prefers to be out fighting or in the wine tent drinking.

rooms.name: The Battlefield
rooms.description:
You are walking across the battlefield before the walls of Troy, where the
besieging army of the Achaeans, led by Agamemnon, have sat encamped for
years, the monotony only broken by the occasional battle. Tents lay
everywhere, housing the many soldiers that currently call this place home.

rooms.name: The Battlefield
rooms.description:
You are walking across the battlefield before the walls of Troy, where the
besieging army of the Achaeans, led by Agamemnon, have sat encamped for
years, the monotony only broken by the occasional battle. Tents lay
everywhere, housing the many soldiers that currently call this place home.

rooms.name: Nestor's Tent
rooms.description:
This is the tent of King Nestor, leader of the contingent from Pylos. He
is one of the older generals here, and one of the more wiser. However,
he is not one of the more influential.

rooms.name: Odysseus' Tent
rooms.description:
This is the tent of noble Odysseus, the most notable of all the heroes
assembled for this battle. Chances are he won't be here, but rather off
fixing up his little equine surprise for the Trojans...

rooms.name: The Battlefield
rooms.description:
You are walking across the battlefield before the walls of Troy, where the
besieging army of the Achaeans, led by Agamemnon, have sat encamped for
years, the monotony only broken by the occasional battle. Tents lay
everywhere, housing the many soldiers that currently call this place home.

rooms.name: Menelaus' Tent
rooms.description:
Here resides King Menelaus of Sparta, the man who is at the center of all
the trouble, for it is his wife (Helen) everyone from all over Greece is
here to rescue. He must feel terribly embarrassed for having dragged half of
Greece to some remote Turkish city for 9 years.

rooms.name: Agamemnon's Tent
rooms.description:
Here the head of the Achaean expedition resides, and also holds his staff
meetings. Battle plans hang on the walls and are also strewn over tables,
chairs, cots and the floor. Agamemnon is rather irritated at having spent
nine years in this tent, and the stress is starting to show.

rooms.name: The Physicians' Tent
rooms.description:
Here Machaon, son of Asclepius, and his brother tend to the sick and the
wounded. They will even tend your injuries, for a fee.

rooms.name: The Battlefield
rooms.description:
You are walking across the battlefield before the walls of Troy, where the
besieging army of the Achaeans, led by Agamemnon, have sat encamped for
years, the monotony only broken by the occasional battle. Tents lay
everywhere, housing the many soldiers that currently call this place home.

rooms.name: The Battlefield
rooms.description:
You are walking across the battlefield before the walls of Troy, where the
besieging army of the Achaeans, led by Agamemnon, have sat encamped for
years, the monotony only broken by the occasional battle. Tents lay
everywhere, housing the many soldiers that currently call this place home.

rooms.name: The Games
rooms.description:
Even during times of war, the Achaeans find time for competitive sports
meets, and this war is no exception. This area has been converted into
a rudimentary arena, with lanes for running and chariot racing, circles
for discus and shotput, and a ring for boxing.

rooms.name: The Games
rooms.description:
Even during times of war, the Achaeans find time for competitive sports
meets, and this war is no exception. This area has been converted into
a rudimentary arena, with lanes for running and chariot racing, circles
for discus and shotput, and a ring for boxing.

rooms.name: The Battlefield
rooms.description:
You are walking across the battlefield before the walls of Troy, where the
besieging army of the Achaeans, led by Agamemnon, have sat encamped for
years, the monotony only broken by the occasional battle. Tents lay
everywhere, housing the many soldiers that currently call this place home.

rooms.name: The Battlefield
rooms.description:
You are walking across the battlefield before the walls of Troy, where the
besieging army of the Achaeans, led by Agamemnon, have sat encamped for
years, the monotony only broken by the occasional battle. Tents lay
everywhere, housing the many soldiers that currently call this place home.

rooms.name: Idoemeneus' Tent
rooms.description:
This is the tent of Idomeneus, King of the Cretans (NOT Cretins ;P). He is
Agamemnon's best and most trusted captain, and as such is highly respected
by the Achaeans.

rooms.name: Menestheus' Tent
rooms.description:
Menestheus is a prince from Athens, and leader of the Athenian contingent
sent to the war. He is not a major player so I won't give him a major
room description.

rooms.name: The Battlefield
rooms.description:
You are walking across the battlefield before the walls of Troy, where the
besieging army of the Achaeans, led by Agamemnon, have sat encamped for
years, the monotony only broken by the occasional battle. Tents lay
everywhere, housing the many soldiers that currently call this place home.

rooms.name: Tlepolemus' Tent
rooms.description:
This is the tent of the Argive prince Tlepolemus, son of the legendary
Heracles. He is a mighty warrior and a great ally of the Achaean forces.
Notice how all these Achaeans have names ending with 's'?

rooms.name: Aias the Greater's Tent
rooms.description:
This is the tent of Aias the Greater, the best archer of all the Achaeans,
and a superb athlete. He is most probably currently competing in some
competition even as we speak.

rooms.name: The Horse
rooms.description:
This is a broad clearing full of tradesmen and a huge, half-finished wooden
horse. You see scattered about the clearing wooden rabbits, badgers, stoats,
turtles, hawks and echidnas. Evidently a lot of thought went into the final
choice for the lure...

rooms.name: The Battlefield
rooms.description:
You are walking across the battlefield before the walls of Troy, where the
besieging army of the Achaeans, led by Agamemnon, have sat encamped for
years, the monotony only broken by the occasional battle. Tents lay
everywhere, housing the many soldiers that currently call this place home.

rooms.name: Diomedes' Tent
rooms.description:
This is the tent of Diomedes, King of Argos, the most amicable and well-
liked of the Achaean leaders on the field. He is also a competent warrior
and military leader, and engenders great likeness and respect from the
troops.

rooms.name: The Front Line
rooms.description:
You are on the front line, in the midst of the field that has hosted the
bulk of the senseless conflict between Achaean and Trojan. The blood of
thousands slain on both sides has soaked into the soil here, and there are
weapons, armor and bones littered all about here.

rooms.name: The Front Line

thousands slain on both sides has soaked into the soil here, and there are
weapons, armor and bones littered all about here.

rooms.name: The Front Line
rooms.description:
You are on the front line, in the midst of the field that has hosted the
bulk of the senseless conflict between Achaean and Trojan. The blood of
thousands slain on both sides has soaked into the soil here, and there are
weapons, armor and bones littered all about here.

The City of Troy lies directly to the north.

The City of Troy lies directly to the north.

rooms.name: The Front Line
rooms.description:
You are on the front line, in the midst of the field that has hosted the
bulk of the senseless conflict between Achaean and Trojan. The blood of
thousands slain on both sides has soaked into the soil here, and there are
weapons, armor and bones littered all about here.

The City of Troy lies directly to the west.

rooms.name: Outside the Gates of Ilium
rooms.description:
The Gates of Ilium loom before you, tall and magnificent. They are crafted
of solid oak bound with bronze. Surprisingly, they are closed but unlocked-
the Achaean never thought to turn the handle...;)

rooms.name: The Streets of Ilium
rooms.description:
You are standing on a street in the city of Ilium, also known as Troy.
Trojans run here and there, with worried looks on their faces, for they
are concerned for the safety of their city and their families during this
war. This state of war has lasted for nine years, with no sign of abating.
The city gates lie to the south.

rooms.name: The Streets of Ilium
rooms.description:
You are standing on a street in the city of Ilium, also known as Troy.
Trojans run here and there, with worried looks on their faces, for they
are concerned for the safety of their city and their families during this
war. This state of war has lasted for nine years, with no sign of abating.
The massive walls of the city that loom to the west look strong enough to
repel any foe, though.

rooms.description:

Trojans run here and there, with worried looks on their faces, for they
are concerned for the safety of their city and their families during this
war. This state of war has lasted for nine years, with no sign of abating.
The massive walls of the city that loom to the west look strong enough to
repel any foe, though.

rooms.name: A Residence
rooms.description:
This is the home of some important citizen of Troy. Fine tapestries adorn
the walls, while a thick rug woven from materials unfamiliar to you
covers the stone floor. There is an ornate sofa near one wall, and a table
holding a bronze urn near the doorway.

rooms.name: The Streets of Ilium
rooms.description:
You are standing on a street in the city of Ilium, also known as Troy.
Trojans run here and there, with worried looks on their faces, for they
are concerned for the safety of their city and their families during this
war. This state of war has lasted for nine years, with no sign of abating.
The massive walls of the city that loom to the south look strong enough to
repel any foe, though. The palace lies to the north of here.

rooms.description:

the walls, while a thick rug woven from materials unfamiliar to you
covers the stone floor. There is an ornate sofa near one wall, and a table

Trojans run here and there, with worried looks on their faces, for they

war. This state of war has lasted for nine years, with no sign of abating.
The massive walls of the city that loom to the south look strong enough to
repel any foe, though. The walls of the magnificent palace loom to the
north.

rooms.description:

Trojans run here and there, with worried looks on their faces, for they
are concerned for the safety of their city and their families during this
war. This state of war has lasted for nine years, with no sign of abating.
The massive walls of the city that loom to the east look strong enough to
repel any foe, though.

are concerned for the safety of their city and their families during this
war. This state of war has lasted for nine years, with no sign of abating.
The massive walls of the city that loom to the west look strong enough to

rooms.name: A Residence
rooms.description:

the walls, while a thick rug woven from materials unfamiliar to you
covers the stone floor. There is an ornate sofa near one wall, and a table

rooms.name: The Streets of Ilium
rooms.description:
You are standing on a street in the city of Ilium, also known as Troy.
Trojans run here and there, with worried looks on their faces, for they
are concerned for the safety of their city and their families during this
war. This state of war has lasted for nine years, with no sign of abating.
The massive walls of the city that loom to the south look strong enough to
repel any foe, though. The entrance to the palace is directly north of
you.

rooms.name: A Residence
rooms.description:
This is the home of some important citizen of Troy. Fine tapestries adorn
the walls, while a thick rug woven from materials unfamiliar to you
covers the stone floor. There is an ornate sofa near one wall, and a table
holding a bronze urn near the doorway.

rooms.name: The Streets of Ilium
rooms.description:
You are standing on a street in the city of Ilium, also known as Troy.
Trojans run here and there, with worried looks on their faces, for they
are concerned for the safety of their city and their families during this
war. This state of war has lasted for nine years, with no sign of abating.
The massive walls of the city that loom to the east look strong enough to
repel any foe, though.

rooms.name: The End of the Road
rooms.description:
The road ends here at the sheer face of the northern wall of the city, which
faces onto the tall, impenetrable mountains that loom north of the plains
of Ilium.

However, you may climb the wall here at a weak point should you wish to.

rooms.name: Inside the Palace
rooms.description:
This opulent abode is heavily furnished with items of bronze, gold and silver.
There is a central throne room to the north of here. This place appears to
be fairly deserted compared to the rest of the city.

rooms.name: The End of the Road
rooms.description:
The road ends here at the sheer face of the northern wall of the city, which
faces onto the tall, impenetrable mountains that loom north of the plains
of Ilium.

rooms.name: Atop the Walls
rooms.description:
You are strolling along the battlements of the mammoth walls of Troy. To
the south lies the massive battlefield where Trojans have fought Achaeans
for the last nine years. To the west lies the wine-dark sea.

rooms.name: Atop the Walls
rooms.description:
You are strolling along the battlements of the mammoth walls of Troy. To
the south lies the massive battlefield where Trojans have fought Achaeans
for the last nine years. To the west lies the wine-dark sea.

rooms.name: Atop the Walls
rooms.description:
You are strolling along the battlements of the mammoth walls of Troy. To
the south lies the massive battlefield where Trojans have fought Achaeans
for the last nine years. To the east lies the wine-dark sea.

Progress further south is prevented by a new barricade. Evidently this
section of the city has been hard-pressed in the siege.

rooms.name: The Center of the Palace
rooms.description:
Here stands the throne of King Priam, and is the room in which he conducts
business and receives visitors. To the north, east and west lie the chambers
of his family.

rooms.name: Chambers
rooms.description:
In these luxurious rooms reside the many members of Priam's family. Soft
cushions and fabrics are draped over ornate furniture while naked slaves
walk about pouring wine for the residents who are currently relaxing here.
Even in times of war, the rich citizens of Ilium live well.

rooms.name: Chambers
rooms.description:
In these luxurious rooms reside the many members of Priam's family. Soft
cushions and fabrics are draped over ornate furniture while naked slaves
walk about pouring wine for the residents who are currently relaxing here.
Even in times of war, the rich citizens of Ilium live well.

cushions and fabrics are draped over ornate furniture while naked slaves

Even in times of war, the rich citizens of Ilium live well.
